title: House Robber
description: You are a professional robber planning to rob houses along a street. Each house has a certain amount of money stashed, the only constraint stopping you from to robbing each of them is that adjacent houses have security systems connected and it will automatically contact the police if two adjacent houses were broken into on the same night. Given an integer array nums representing the amount of money of each house, return the maximum amount of money you can rob tonight without alerting the police.

brute-force.name: Recursive
brute-force.description: Recursively choose to rob or skip.

steps.instruction: Define the function rob that takes nums.

steps.hint:
Recursive function. At each house, either rob it (and skip next) or skip it. Return max.

Example:
Nums=[1, 2].
i=0: Max(1 + DFS(2), DFS(1))
  DFS(2): 0.
  DFS(1): Max(2 + DFS(3), DFS(2)) = 2.
Max(1, 2) = 2.

optimal.name: DP (Iterative)
optimal.description: Maintain max loot for previous two houses.

steps.instruction: Define the function rob that takes nums.

steps.hint: Initialize two variables to keep track of the max loot ending at the previous two houses.

steps.placeholderCode:
for n in nums:
        temp = max(n + rob1, rob2)
        rob1 = rob2
        rob2 = temp
steps.hint:
Iterate. `temp` is max of robbing current house + loot from 2 houses ago (`rob1`) OR skipping current house (`rob2`). Update `rob1` and `rob2`.

Example:
Nums=[1, 2, 3, 1]. Init: Rob1=0, Rob2=0.
House 1: Max(1+0, 0) = 1. Rob1=0, Rob2=1.
House 2: Max(2+0, 1) = 2. Rob1=1, Rob2=2.
House 3: Max(3+1, 2) = 4. Rob1=2, Rob2=4.
House 1: Max(1+2, 4) = 4. Rob1=4, Rob2=4.
steps.solutionCode:
for n in nums:
        temp = max(n + rob1, rob2)
        rob1 = rob2
        rob2 = temp

steps.hint: Return the final accumulated max loot.
